BITCOIN TYPICALLY PEAKS 18 MONTHS AFTER EACH HALVING. 

WILL HISTORY REPEAT ITSELF?

Historically, Bitcoin reaches its cycle peak around 18 months after each halving.

If this pattern holds, the next peak could occur in September, aligning with a potential Fed rate cut.

But what makes this cycle different?

‚û°Ô∏è  It's institutionally driven
‚û°Ô∏è  Exhibits less volatility
‚û°Ô∏è  Shows a slower, more stable price climb

Unlike past cycles, we may be in a longer, more sustained bull run.

A Fed rate cut could further fuel this momentum, potentially signaling the beginning of an extended bull market.

This week marks one month at @FuturumEquities  -- and what a ride it‚Äôs been already. I‚Äôm incredibly excited for this next chapter.

One takeaway that‚Äôs really stuck with me: PERCEPTION IS CURRENCY. You can have all the evidence in the world, but if the market doesn‚Äôt see it yet, it doesn‚Äôt matter.

I‚Äôm seeing the disconnects everywhere:
‚Ä¢ $GOOGL: Everyone‚Äôs caught up in the ‚Äúsearch is dead‚Äù narrative, but that‚Äôs surface-level thinking. Google owns the full AI infrastructure stack --TPUs, orchestration, data, models, distribution. In an agentic AI future, that stack becomes the operating layer. They‚Äôre not just defensible -- they‚Äôre embedded.

‚Ä¢ $NVDA: Talk of custom silicon, margin compression, and training demand slowing misses the real point. Nvidia isn‚Äôt a chip company -- it‚Äôs a platform. CUDA is the most valuable developer ecosystem in AI. As long as the world trains and deploys models, $NVDA remains the control layer for AI. 

‚Ä¢ $AMD: They don‚Äôt need to beat Nvidia. They just need a credible lane. If AMD captures even low double-digit share of the accelerator market, they‚Äôre printing cash. MI300 is gaining traction, and hyperscalers want optionality. The TAM is expanding -- they‚Äôre in the right place.

‚Ä¢ $TSLA: Everyone focuses on car margins. But Tesla is building the only vertically integrated AI network for real-world autonomy. If they get even partway to robotaxi or Optimus scale, the market will have to reprice the entire business model. This isn‚Äôt about vehicles -- it‚Äôs about AI-native infrastructure for mobility and labor.

These are just a few Futurum signals I‚Äôm seeing -- the perception just hasn‚Äôt caught up yet.
Woah $TSLA just posted an 8.8 Value Sense Momentum Score -- could the market finally be realizing car delivery numbers reflect the Tesla of the past, not the company it‚Äôs becoming?

$SPX updated:
The upside: Continued squeeze off of the original bull flag to ever more record highs with no sign of reversal yet.
The downside: Little room for error on the chart.

However:

Slowing immigration, increased deportations, and the continuing low fertility rate (for decades), means population growth has really slowed.

This has lead some estimates that the economy now only needs to create 20k to 40k jobs a month to meet the now lower population growth.

So yes, 74k private sector jobs is slowing. But it‚Äôs more than enough to meet the economy‚Äôs needs. 

The bond market reacted appropriately given this reality.

US JOBS 

= as we were Nowcasting, this was another month of NON-recessionary US labor data

Slowing? Yes, but not discrete enough to shift the near-term policy calculus (July FOMC), particularly with Jobless Claims printing benignly (again), ISM Services New Orders back in Expansion and (what we expect to be) a relatively hawkish CPI update in queue @HedgeyeUSA

are levels of interest

Snowpack vs river flows

Inter market, multi timeframe analysis and how to plan your July 4 river activities

The CO snow pack ‚ö´Ô∏è (Platte River Basin) doesn't peak until late March/early April.

A couple weeks after the snow pack entered a stage 4 decline river flows üîµ broke out to a stage 2 uptrend as they rose from the low flow, dormant winter levels

The rivers peaked around June 14 this year and are now in a stage 4 decline.

The pink 30 day river flow chart shows a series of LH and LL since about the 14th.   

Here is where the forecast comes in.  

If you are looking to go tubing/kayaking/ rafting, the peak flows (bounce in downtrend) occur at approximately 8AM 

If you are looking for best fishing condition, the lowest flows occur at approx 5PM which makes the evening best for fishing.

It is counter intuitive to think the lower flows occur in the evening but it takes a while for that snow to melt and head downstream.

Life Hack

Register your car in your wife's name and your car in her name

Then if you get a moving violation traffic ticket from a camera you can show that you were not driving your (her) car and don't have to pay!

A recent analysis by DataWeave (conducted for Reuters) found that a basket of 1,400 products made in China and sold on Amazon.com rose faster than inflation between January and mid-June, implying tariffs may now be seeping into consumer prices.
While it remained in contraction territory, China's official manufacturing PMI ticked up to 49.7 in June, up from 49.5 in May, beating forecasts.
Excellent summary. Check this thread and follow @UnicusResearch.

Few understand this.

The past is dead.
It exists only in your mind, and you are the one keeping it alive. But here‚Äôs the truth: the past has no inherent meaning except for the meaning you choose to assign to it. You don‚Äôt have to forget what happened or pretend it didn‚Äôt exist. You simply have to revise its meaning.

That is the secret to happiness.
That is the gateway to success.

Would you like to know the first and most important secret to becoming hugely successful?

Ok, here it is:
Stop being bitter about the past.

Beacause all the money or success in the world isn't going to do anything to make your sorry ass happy, if you can't be so intensely grateful for being alive, that the past doesn't matter. 

When you become and live THAT, amazing things become possible in every aspect of your life.
